radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal results on routine EEG recording in wakefulness and stage 1 sleep.
Multiple events occurring during stage 2 sleep similar to prior studies; a paucity of slow-wave sleep and complete absence of REM sleep.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On second day of admission, application of a nicotine patch led to almost complete resolution of clinical and electrical events and increased duration of slow-wave sleep and recorded REM sleep.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Absence of slow-wave sleep and reduced amounts of REM sleep, without any evidence of central or obstructive apnea.
